result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference:
Abstract
The catalyst is prepared by facile thermal treatment and chemical deposition method. The SnS 2 Aug-C 3 N 4 composites show a superior optical adsorption under UV-vis light. The Au nanoparticle and the Z-type scheme jointly improve the separation of carrier. The SnS 2 3ml-Aug-C 3 N 4 displays the best photoreduction activity and durability.
Experimental

4 can be identified as a stable photocatalyst, and Au nanoparticles play a vital role in exciting electrons and enhancing photo-generated carrier for effective separation 71. In order to further determine the active substance of the photocatalytic process, electron spin resonance (ESR) was used to verify the existence of hydroxyl radicals (OH) and superoxide radicals (O 2 -) in the photocatalyst under UV-vis light illumination 35.Fig. 10 shows that before and during simulation sunlight exposure, the ESR

of SnS 2 Aug-C 3 N 4 photocatalytic activity is thanks to the existence and uniform distribution of Au nanoparticles, and with the emergence of more carriers and excited electrons, SnS 2 3ml-Aug-C 3 N 4 showed the best activity for CO 2 photoreduction under the sunlight irradiation 69.Meanwhile, it is found that there is a trace of hydrogen in the reaction process through the TCD detection, but it may be directly burned in the FID detection, resulting in the absence of hydrogen peaks in the gas

of hydrogen peaks in the gas chromatography (Fig. S9).Analysis of liquid-phase products by LC-MS revealed that no carbon-containing products are detected in the reaction products except for the sacrificial agent TEOA.This may be because there were no other carbon-containing products or the content was too low to detect. As we all know, reusability and stability are significant criteria for judging the photocatalysts' quality and further energy application.The composite material also has good cycle

reduce the average lifetime of carrier, so that they reach the site of the reaction prior to losing energy 15.In conclusion, the SnS 2 Aug-C 3 N 4 composite photocatalyst has the best photocatalytic activity under light irradiation. result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX

when irradiated by the visible light, e --h pairs are photogenerated in SnS 2 and g-C 3 N 4 .The photoexcited h probably remain in SnS 2 VB, whereas the e -in SnS 2 CB transfers to VB of g-C 3 N 4 due to ohmic contact.The e -in g-C 3 N 4 VB is further stimulated to its CB, which is beneficial to improve the efficiency towards the separation of e --h pairs.The h stored in SnS 2 VB is trapped in H 2 O molecule to produce H and O 2 .Simultaneously, the e -in g-C 3 N 4 CB is transmitted to its surface, which

as shown in Fig. S11, SnS 2 was incapable of generating CH 4 even after long irradiation (400), suggesting that effective accumulation and extraction of photoinduced electrons in SnS 2 are not allowed, most likely due to fast charge recombination.For the SnS 2 Aug-C 3 N 4 hybrid, if electrons transferred through the conventional heterojunction route, the photoinduced electrons of g-C 3 N 4 would transfer to the CB of SnS 2 .Consequently, CH 4 will not be produced.Meanwhile, when irradiated by the visible
